Based on your preferences, I would recommend "Red Cliff" as an excellent choice for you.

This epic historical film takes place during China's Three Kingdoms period and follows the story of a battle fought in this region by three major Chinese kingdoms - Shu Han (Sichuan), Wei Han (Yangtze River), Yu Han (Hubei).

The film stars some of the most talented actors in Hollywood, including Zhang Yimou (director), Wang Xiaoming (actor), Liu Dehua (actor), Sun Liang (actor), etc.

This epic historical film tells a thrilling story full of action, suspense, and drama. It will keep you on the edge of your seat from start to finish.

Overall, "Red Cliff" is an excellent choice for someone who enjoys epic historical films with plenty of action, suspense, and drama.

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text:
Based on the user's preferences, here are some recommendations:

- Title: Three Kings (1999) ) | Plot: Three Kings is a modern documentary that focuses on three triathletes from the same small town training for the triathlon World Championships.
One of the athletes, Bill Chaffey, was training for his first Olympic distance triathlon when he was involved in a horrendous accident that left him a paraplegic.
For four years he trained himself in the disciplines of wheelchair and hand cycle racing to complete his dream of completing a triathlon and representing Australia in a World event while remaining just one of the boys.

- Title: Old Yeller (1956) ) | Plot: A teenage boy grows to love a stray yellow dog while helping his mother and younger brother run their Texas homestead while their father is away on a cattle drive.
First thought to be good-for-nothing mutt, Old Yeller is soon beloved by all.

- Title: Amen. (2002) ) | Plot: During WWII SS officer Kurt Gerstein tries to inform Pope Pius XII about Jews being sent to extermination camps.
Young Jesuit priest Riccardo Fontana helps him in the difficult mission to inform the world.
